title: Finding open ports
content: Your goal is to get access to the **server**. You know that there is a **telnet** service running on the server but it is not running on the default port. Your first task is to find the **port** on which the telnet service is running. The answer is the port number.
solution:
1. Look for open ports using the command **`nmap -p- 192.168.20.5`**. You can see **ssh** running on port **22** and some other service running on port **${ANSWER}**. This has to be the **telnet** service.

2. Enter **`${ANSWER}`** as the answer.

hints.title: Tool to find open ports
hints.content: A common tool to find open ports is **nmap**. You can learn how to use nmap using **`nmap --help`** or by searching online.
